headline.seo: Yoga Classes Cater to the Overweight

docs.lead_paragraph: Typically, yoga studios are not havens for the plus-size set, but classes that cater to the overweight have spread across the country over the last decade.
docs.snippet: Typically, yoga studios are not havens for the plus-size set, but classes that cater to the overweight have spread across the country over the last decade.

headline.main: The Car Lover vs. the Car-Free

docs.abstract: Where pedestrians are aliens and cars are king.
docs.lead_paragraph: We had more than 400 comments on our discussion about whether it's possible to live without a car in most places in the United States. Readers shared their stories of doing without cars in places like Scottsdale, Ariz., Columbus, Ohio, rural Nevada, Las Vegas, Delray Beach, Fla., Boise and Salem, Mass. Others said that our forum was elitist and urban-centric and that we failed to take account of Americans' love of their cars and open spaces. Here are excerpts from the comments.
docs.snippet: Where pedestrians are aliens and cars are king.

docs.abstract: The nation has lots of "walkable" places. But giving up the automobile is another thing altogether.
docs.lead_paragraph: Updated, May 13, 9:10 a.m. | Alex Marshall, the transportation columnist for Governing magazine, has joined our discussion.
docs.snippet: The nation has lots of "walkable" places. But giving up the automobile is another thing altogether.

byline.original: By KATE PHILLIPS and JANIE LORBER

docs.abstract: From health care to financing the war, this week promises to be busy.
docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama plans to take up the issue of overhauling the health care system on Monday, in a session with doctors and representatives from hospitals, drug makers and insurance companies at the White House late in the morning.
docs.snippet: From health care to financing the war, this week promises to be busy.

headline.main: New Search Tool Aims at Answering Tough Queries, but Not at Taking on Google

docs.lead_paragraph: WolframAlpha doesn’t work like Web search engines, but instead mines vast pools of data collected by the company.

headline.print_headline: Congress Plans Incentives for Employers That Offer Wellness Programs
headline.main: Congress Plans Incentives for Healthy Habits

headline.print_headline: Other Illness May Precede Worst Cases Of Swine Flu
headline.main: Other Illness May Precede Worst Cases of Swine Flu

byline.contributor: Ian Austen contributed reporting from Ottawa.

docs.lead_paragraph: United States and international health officials say many of those hit hardest by the H1N1 virus had conditions like asthma or diabetes.
docs.snippet: United States and international health officials say many of those hit hardest by the H1N1 virus had conditions like asthma or diabetes.
